SourceText:
Crisis can happen to anyone. 

Let's see what happened with @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 and @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver:
text:
Hali ya hatari inaweza kumtokea mtu yeyote.

Hebu tuone kilichotokea kwa @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 na @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver:

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?"
text: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Jamani, mpendwa wangu, unaonekana unasikitika sana, unataka kuniambia kilichotokea?"
note: The string @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "It’s true, he… he… made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I didn’t want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble."

@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault."
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "Ni kweli, ali-… ali-… alisabisha nifanye hivyo! Alisababisha nifanye naye mapenzi! Naapa, sikutaka; hadi nikasema HAPANA, lakini akaniambia nitapata shida."

@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Asante kwa kunishirikisha mimi pia. Usihofu. Hili sio kosa lako."

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Ah I know, let’s go to the clinic. They will know what we can do to help you. Does that sound okay to you?"

@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "Yes… Okay… But will you come with me?"
text:
@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Ah najua, twende kliniki. Wao watajua tufanye nini ili kukusaidia. Je, hiyo ni sawa kwako?"

@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "Ndiyo… Sawa… Lakini, je, tunaenda wote na wewe?"

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Of course I will. And @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1? Remember this is not your fault. I love you. You are a good person. We will get through this."
text: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Ni sawa kabisa. Na @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1? Kumbuka hili siyo kosa lako. Ninakupenda. Wewe ni mtu mzuri. Tutalimaliza hili."

SourceText: This was such a difficult situation for @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 and her @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver! This can happen to boys and girls.
text: Huu ulikuwa wakati mgumu sana kwa @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 na @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver wake! Jambo hili linaweza kuwatokea wavulana na wasichana.

SourceText: What skills did @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver use?
text: Je, @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver alitumia ujuzi upi?
note: The string @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: Yes, @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver actually used all those skills – and so can you!
text: Ndiyo, kwa hakika @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver alitumia ujuzi huo wote – na wewe pia unaweza!
note: The string @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: Another problem that many parents are worried about is violence and crime. Let’s look at an example together.
text: Tatizo jingine ambalo wazazi wengi wana wasiwasi nalo ni vurugu na uhalifu. Hebu tuangalie pamoja mfano mmoja.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1, you look worried since yesterday. What is wrong?"
text: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1, unaonekana una wasiwasi tangu jana. Kuna tatizo gani?"

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Yesterday, my friends and I went to a soccer match. Some guys who were drunk started a fight with my friend."

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Continue, I am listening. I hope you did not fight?"
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Jana, mimi na marafiki zangu tulienda kwenye mpira. Kuna vijana waliokuwa wamelewa, walianza kupigana na rafiki yangu."

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Endelea, ninakusikiliza. Natumaini haukupigana?"

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "I didn’t want to, but I couldn’t just stand there and let them beat up my friend, so…"

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "So, did you fight in order to help defend your friend?"
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Sikutaka kupigana, lakini nisingeweza kukaa tu hapo na kuwaacha wampige rafiki yangu, kwa hiyo..."

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Kwa hiyo, ulipigana ili kumtetea rafiki yako?"

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: “Everyone was fighting. I saw someone lying on the field in a pool of blood. He looked… dead."
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: “Kila mtu alikuwa anapigana. Niliona mtu mmoja amelala uwanjani kwenye dimbwi la damu. Alionekana... amefariki."
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "I am glad you are telling me about this, @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1. Let’s sit down together now and discuss whether we should involve the police or someone else to help."
text: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Nimefurahi unaniambia kuhusu jambo hili, @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1. Hebu tukae pamoja sasa na kujadili iwapo tunapaswa kuwahusisha polisi au mtu mwingine wa kutusaidia."

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Thank you, @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1"

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "We will get through this. Remember, we will support you as a family."
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Asante, @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1"

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Tutalimaliza hili. Kumbuka, tutakusaidia kama familia."

SourceText: This was such a difficult situation for @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1 and his @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1!
text: Huu ulikuwa wakati mgumu sana kwa @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1 na @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1 wake!

SourceText: What skills did @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1 use?
text: Je, @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1 alitumia ujuzi upi?
note: The string @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: All these skills can help in a crisis.
text: Ujuzi wote huu unaweza kusaidia kwenye hali ya hatari.

SourceText: Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think.
text: Mgogoro unaweza kutufanya tukasirike au tujione wanyonge. Lakini huo ndio wakati hasa ambao vijana wetu wanatuhitaji sisi. Tuvute pumzi, tusikilize na kufikiri.

SourceText: BREATHE
text: VUTA PUMZI

SourceText: Stay calm. Ask yourself ‘what does my teen need right now’
text: Tulia. Jiulize 'kijana wangu anahitaji nini sasa hivi'

SourceText: LISTEN
text: SIKILIZA

SourceText: Tell them you are there for them and love them.
text: Mwambie upo kwa ajili yake na mpende.

SourceText: THINK
text: FIKIRI

SourceText: Talk with your teen. What might help the situation? You might need to make immediate plans now, and then long-term plans later.
text: Zungumza na kijana wako. Kitu gani kinaweza kusaidia kwenye hali hiyo? Unaweza kutakiwa kupanga mipango ya haraka sasa, halafu mipango ya muda mrefu baadaye.

SourceText: You can be proud of yourself for exploring ways to get help!
text: Jionee fahari kwa kutafuta njia za kupata msaada!

SourceText:
It’s helpful to practice dealing with crisis before something happens. 

Look at these five family crisis times. Imagine you are the parent: What would you do?

Remember:  BREATHE - LISTEN - THINK
text:
Inasaidia sana kufanyia mazoezi namna ya kukabiliana na hali ya matatizo kabla haijatokea.

Hebu angalia nyakati hizi tano za matatizo katika familia. Chukulia kwamba wewe ni mzazi: Ungefanya nini?

Kumbuka: VUTA PUMZI – SIKILIZA – FIKIRI

SourceText: Crisis 1: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 fights at school
text: Tatizo la kwanza: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 amepigana shuleni
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2: "I’ve never done this before. And now they will expel me"
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2: "Sijawahi kufanya hivi. Na sasa watanifukuza."
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 should not be translated.

SourceText: Crisis 2: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 gets pregnant
text: Tatizo la Pili: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 amepata ujauzito
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1, I’m so ashamed. I don’t know what to do"
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1, ninaona aibu sana. Sijui cha kufanya."

SourceText: Crisis 3: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 makes a girl pregnant
text: Tatizo la Tatu: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 amempa msichana mimba
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2: "@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_2, I don’t want to have a baby"
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2: "@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_2, sitaki kupata mtoto."

SourceText: How could you respond to @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2?
text: Utafanyaje kwa @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2?
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 should not be translated.

SourceText: Crisis 4: Someone in the family gets sick
text: Tatizo la Nne: Mwanafamilia anaugua

SourceText: "The test said I have HIV. I’m scared I’m going to die"
text: "Vipimo vimeonesha nina VVU. Ninaogopa, nitakufa"

SourceText: How could you respond in this situation?
text: Je, unafanyaje kwenye hali hii?

SourceText: Crisis 5: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 is pressured into sex by her boyfriend
text: Tatizo la Tano: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 anashinikizwa kufanya ngono na mpenzi wake
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "I didn’t really want to. Now I will get pregnant or be ill. @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver, I’m so scared..."
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "Kwa kweli sikutaka kabisa kufanya hivyo. Sasa nitapata mimba au nitaumwa. @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver, ninaogopa sana..."

SourceText: How could you respond to @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1?
text: Je, utafanyaje kwa @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1?
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: Remember to support and encourage each other. It is hard to remain calm and listen to each other in a crisis - we are proud of you.
text: Kumbukeni kusaidiana na kutiana moyo. Ni vigumu kuendelea kutulia na kusikilizana kwenye hali ya tatizo – tunawaonea fahari.

SourceText:
With your teen choose one of these situations (or think of one yourself!). Look at the cartoon, and discuss what you would do together if this happened to a friend or in your family. 

And remember: BREATHE  - LISTEN - THINK
text:
Chagua hali mojawapo kati ya hizi pamoja na kijana wako (au chagua mwenyewe!). Angalieni katuni, halafu mjadili pamoja mtafanya nini kama hali hiyo itatokea kwa rafiki au kwenye familia yenu.

Na kumbukeni: VUTA PUMZI – SIKILIZA – FIKIRI

SourceText: Crisis Examples
text: Mifano ya Hali ya Tatizo

SourceText:
You’ve completed this week’s workshop. 

Next week’s workshop will celebrate you all, and help you plan for the future. 

Why don’t you plan some party food together, and have some music ready if you like to dance!
text:
Umemaliza warsha ya wiki hii.

Warsha ya wiki ijayo tutasherehekea nyinyi nyote, na kuwasaidia kupanga mipango ya siku zijazo.

Kwa nini msipange kufanya pamoja sherehe itakayokuwa na chakula, na kuandaa muziki kama mtapenda kucheza!

SourceText:
You’ve completed this week’s workshop. 

Next week’s workshop will celebrate you, and you can choose the support you want going forward. 

You can prepare a treat to celebrate – something you like to eat, or music you like to listen to!
text:
Umemaliza warsha ya wiki hii.

Warsha ya wiki ijayo tutakusherehekea wewe, na unaweza kuchagua msaada unaoutaka ili kusonga mbele.

Unaweza kuandaa sherehe – kitu unachopenda kula, au muziki unaopenda kusikiliza!

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy! Keep up the good work.
text: Vizuri, nimefurahi sana! Endeleza kazi hiyo nzuri.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult. All families struggle. We are here to help!
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kwamba mambo ni magumu. Kila familia inahangaika. Tuko hapa ili kusaidia!

SourceText: Whatever went ‘wrong’ today, let it go and try again tomorrow. It’s okay!
text: Jambo lolote lililoenda 'vibaya' leo, hebu lisahau na ujaribu tena kesho. Itakuwa sawa!

SourceText:
Focus on the positive! 

Telling our teens what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.

You will see the difference.
text:
Zingatia mambo chanya!

Kuwaambia vijana wetu kile hasa tunachotaka wafanye ni vizuri kuliko kuwakataza kufanya kitu.

Utaona mabadiliko.

SourceText:
Greetings, greetings everyone.

Today our topic is positive instructions. 

It is important to give positive instructions to our children, because when we give them positive instructions they know and understand what we are expecting them to do, and they do it the way we want them to do it. 

So, at the end it keeps everyone happy.
text:
Habari zenu?

Leo mada yetu inahusu maelekezo chanya.

Ni muhimu kutoa maagizo chanya kwa watoto wetu, kwa sababu tunapowapa maagizo chanya, wanajua na kuelewa kile tunachotarajia wakifanye, na wanakifanya kwa namna tunavyotaka wakifanye.

Kwa hiyo, mwishowe kila mtu hufurahi.

SourceText: Let’s do a thought experiment!
text: Hebu tufanye jaribio la kufikiria!

SourceText:
DO NOT THINK ABOUT AN ELEPHANT 

What are you thinking about?
text:
USIFIKIRI KUHUSU TEMBO

Unafikiri kuhusu nini?

SourceText:
You probably DID think about an elephant...

‘Don’t do’ instructions make teens think about that thing. 

Sometimes they don’t understand what we DID want from them. 

Also they often don’t like being told not to do things (don’t we all?)
text:
Inawezekana ulifikiri kuhusu tembo...

Maagizo ya 'usifanye kitu hiki' huwafanya vijana wafikirie kuhusu kitu hicho.

Wakati mwingine huwa hawaelewi kile TULICHOTAKA wakifanye.

Pia, mara nyingi hawapendi kuambiwa wasifanye vitu fulani (kuna mtu yeyote anayependa?)

SourceText:
NOW, THINK ABOUT A CHEETAH! 

What are you thinking about?
text:
SASA, FIKIRI KUHUSU DUMA!

Je, unafikiri kuhusu nini?

SourceText:
That’s right! Positive, clear instructions help teens focus on what they should be doing. 

Teens will also feel more respected this way, and are more likely to listen.
text:
Hapo sawa! Maagizo chanya na bayana huwasaidia vijana kuzingatia kile wanachopaswa kufanya.

Kwa njia hiyo, vijana pia watahisi kuheshimiwa zaidi, na wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kusikiliza.

SourceText: Let’s see what happens if @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver tells @global.w_instruct_teen_girl "DON'T":
text: Hebu tuone ni nini kitatokea kama @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver atamwambia @global.w_instruct_teen_girl "USIFANYE HIKI":

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver was cleaning the house while @global.w_instruct_teen_girl was practicing dance moves with her friend.

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Don’t make such a mess while I am cleaning the house. You are in the way!”
text:
@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver alikuwa akisafisha nyumba wakati @global.w_instruct_teen_girl alipokuwa akifanya mazoezi ya kucheza na rafiki yake.

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Usifanye fujo kama hizi wakati ninaposafisha nyumba. Unanizuia! ”

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “But I need to practice for the school competition. You never let me do anything.”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Don’t you talk back to me!”
text:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “Lakini ninahitaji kufanya mazoezi kwa ajili ya mashindano ya shule. Huwa hauniruhusu nifanye chochote.”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Usinijibu hivyo!"

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “Arrg!! Why am I being yelled at all the time????”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver to herself: “That child is always making trouble.”
text:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “Arrg!! Kwa nini huwa unanifokea kila wakati????”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver (akijisemea): "Huyu mtoto analeta shida kila wakati."

SourceText:
Discuss together: 

* How do you think @global.w_instruct_teen_girl felt about the way @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver responded?  
* What could @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver have done differently?
text:
Jadilini pamoja:

* Je, unafikiri @global.w_instruct_teen_girl alijisikiaje namna @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver alivyojibu?
* Je, @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver angeweza kufanya nini tofauti?

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver could have...
text: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver angeweza...
note: The string @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText:
* Said something nice first 
* Spoken to @global.w_instruct_teen_girl in a calm voice 
* Told @global.w_instruct_teen_girl what she wants her to do
text:
* Kusema kitu kizuri kwanza
* Angeongea na @global.w_instruct_teen_girl kwa sauti ya utulivu
* Kumwambia @global.w_instruct_teen_girl kile anachotaka afanye

SourceText: How do you think @global.w_instruct_teen_girl felt about the way @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver responded?
text: Je, unafikiri @global.w_instruct_teen_girl alijisikiaje namna @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver alivyojibu?

SourceText: What could @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver have done differently?
text: Je, @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver angeweza kufanya nini tofauti?
note: The string @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: Said something nice first
text: Alisema kitu kizuri kwanza

SourceText: Spoken to @global.w_instruct_teen_girl in a calm voice
text: Ameongea na @global.w_instruct_teen_girl kwa sauti ya utulivu

SourceText: Told @global.w_instruct_teen_girl what she wants her to do
text: Alimwambia @global.w_instruct_teen_girl kile anachotaka afanye

SourceText:
Thank you for thinking along! 

Let’s go back in time and see what happens if @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver gives a positive instruction:
text:
Asanteni kwa kufikiria pamoja!

Hebu turudi nyuma tuone kinachoweza kutokea kama @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver atatoa maagizo chanya:
note: The string @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Thank you for practicing outside while I finished cleaning, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl. Now I have some time to watch your dance."
text: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Asante kwa kufanyia mazoezi nje nilipokuwa namalizia kufanya usafi, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl. Sasa nina muda wa kuangalia unavyocheza."

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Wow, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl! You have such good dance moves!"
text: @global.w_instruct_female_ caregiver: "Waoo, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl! Unacheza vizuri sana!"

SourceText: Let's discuss what happened this time.
text: Hebu tujadili kilichotokea wakati huu.

SourceText:
Discuss together: 

* How did @global.w_instruct_teen_girl and @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver feel now?
* Why do you think the situation went better for @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver this time?
text:
Jadilini pamoja:

* Je, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl na @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver wanajisikiaje sasa?
* Je, mnadhani ni kwa nini mambo yalimwendea vizuri @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver mara hii?

SourceText: It worked better this time because...
text: Mara hii mambo yalienda vizuri kwa sababu...

SourceText:
* @global.w_instruct_teen_girl felt respected and loved by her @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver
* @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver was able to stay calm  
* @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver  kept a positive attitude
text:
* @global.w_instruct_teen_girl alihisi kuheshimiwa na kupendwa na @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver wake
* @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver aliweza kutulia  
* @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver alikuwa na mtazamo chanya

SourceText: How did @global.w_instruct_teen_girl and @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver feel now?
text: Je, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl na @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver walijisikiaje?

SourceText: Why do you think the situation went better for @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver this time?
text: Je, kwa nini unadhani mambo yalimwendea vizuri @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver mara hii?
note: The string @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_teen_girl felt respected and loved by her @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver
text: @global.w_instruct_teen_girl alihisi kuheshimiwa na kupendwa na @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver wake

SourceText: Positive instructions can work with your teen too!
text: Maelekezo chanya yanaweza pia kufanya kazi kwa kijana wako!

SourceText: GET REAL
text: KUWA HALISI

SourceText: Can your teen actually do what you are about to ask? It may be impossible for them to read quietly all day, but half an hour when you really need it is realistic.
text: Je, kijana wako anaweza kweli kufanya kile unachotaka kumwambia? Inaweza kuwa vigumu kwao kusoma kimya kwa siku nzima, lakini ukimwambia afanye hivyo kwa nusu saa unapohitaji sana afanye hivyo, ni jambo linalotekelezeka.

SourceText: GET POSITIVE
text: KUWA NA MTAZAMO CHANYA

SourceText: Smile, look them in the eye, and use positive words. Praise them as soon as they start to do what you ask!
text: Tabasamu, mwangalie machoni, na tumia maneno chanya. Msifie mara tu anapoanza kufanya kile unachotaka!

SourceText: GET  CLEAR
text: KUWA BAYANA

SourceText: Often we know what we want in our head, but we don’t say it clearly enough. Say exactly what you want your teen to do. Try ‘please come home by 7pm’ instead of ‘come home in time’.
text: Mara nyingi tunajua nafsini mwetu kile tunachokitaka, lakini hakitusemi bayana kiasi cha kueleweka. Sema kile unachotaka kuona kijana wako akifanye. Jaribu kusema 'tafadhali, ifikapo saa 1 jioni uwe tayari umerudi nyumbani' badala ya kusema 'uwahi kurudi nyumbani'.

SourceText: Let's practice giving REAL, POSITIVE and CLEAR instructions. Practice will help you be successful with your teen!
text: Hebu tufanye mazoezi ya kutoa maelekezo YANAYOTEKELEZEKA, CHANYA, na BAYANA. Kufanya mazoezi kutakusaidia kufanikiwa kwa kijana wako!

SourceText:
Choose two people from your group:
* One person pretends to be a teenager
* The other pretends to be the teenager’s parent
* “Parent”: Give your “teen” a positive instruction with encouragement and praise
* “Teen”: Respond as you think a teen may respond to this 

Discuss together how that went:
* How did this make you feel as “parent” and as “teen”?
* Could you do anything better?

Give everyone a chance to be the “parent” and the “teen” if you can. Practice brings success!
text:
Chagueni watu wawili kwenye kikundi chenu:
* Mtu mmoja ataigiza kama kijana
* Mwingine ataigiza kama mzazi wa kijana
* “Mzazi”: Mpe "kijana" wako maagizo chanya kwa kumtia moyo na kumsifia
* “Kijana”: Itikia kama unavyodhani kijana ataitikia maneno hayo

Jadilini pamoja jinsi mambo yalivyoenda:
* Je, imekufanya ujisikieje kama "mzazi" na kama "kijana"?
* Je, unaweza kufanya chochote vizuri zaidi?

Mpeni kila mtu nafasi ya kuwa "mzazi" na "kijana" kama mnaweza. Mazoezi huleta ufanisi!

SourceText: Examples of positive instructions:
text: Mifano ya maelekezo chanya:

SourceText:
* I like your music. Could you turn it down during dinner so that we can talk? Thank you – I really appreciate it. 
* That’s great music. Who is the singer? Please turn the music off when you come in the house. You can play it in your room quietly if you want. Thank you!
text:
* Ninapenda muziki wako. Je, unaweza kupunguza sauti wakati wa chakula ili tuweze kuzungumza? Asante – Ninashukuru sana kufanya hivyo.
* Huo muziki ni mzuri sana. Umeimbwa na nani? Tafadhali zima muziki unapoingia nyumbani. Ukitaka, unaweza kuupiga chumbani mwako kwa sauti ya chini. Asante!

SourceText:
This week's home practice is to give your teen positive instructions.

Remember – GET REAL, GET POSITIVE, GET CLEAR = GET EXACTLY WHAT YOU WANT (as much as is possible with a teenager!)
text:
Zoezi la nyumbani la wiki hii ni kumpa kijana wako maagizo chanya.

Kumbuka – KUTOA MAAGIZO YANAYOTEKELEZEKA, KUWA NA MTAZAMO CHANYA, KUELEWEKA = KUPATA KILE HASA UNACHOKITAKA (kadri ya uwezo wa kijana!)

SourceText: Caring for yourself is so essential.
text: Kujitunza ni jambo muhimu sana.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.
text: Ni jambo la kuvutia sana, ninafurahi sana mambo kuona yanaenda vizuri. Endeleza kazi hii nzuri.

SourceText: Take a moment and just be impressed at what you’ve achieved, despite all the other things you have to do each day.
text: Tenga muda kidogo ili ufurahie mafanikio uliyoyapata, licha ya mambo mengine yote unayopaswa kuyafanya kila siku.

SourceText:
Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things! 

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family’s goals.
text:
Familia nyingi zina msongo wa mawazo kutokana na pesa, hasa pale vijana wanapoendelea kuomba vitu!

Tunapotengeneza bajeti pamoja, tunaweza kukubaliana jinsi ya kufanya matumizi pamoja NA kuweka akiba ili kuzuia msongo wa mawazo na kutekeleza malengo ya familia zetu.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is family budgeting. 

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family. 

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family, and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada ya leo inahusu kutengeneza bajeti ya familia.

Kutengeneza bajeti ni muhimu, lakini kutengeneza bajeti kwa kuhusisha familia nzima ni muhimu zaidi.

Kufanya hivyo pamoja husaidia kuongeza uelewa kuhusu jinsi mnavyotumia pesa kama familia na kiasi mnachoweka akiba kwa ajili ya familia, na mnaweza hata kubuni mipango ya kuweka akiba kama familia.

SourceText:
* Story – that didn’t work… 
* Budgeting exercise
* Story & discussion – that worked!
* Story & discussion – that didn’t work…
* Discussion on saving options
* Saving exercise
* Tools: How to budget & save
THINK - CHOOSE - BUILD - PLAN
* Home practice suggestions
text:
* Simulizi – haikufanikiwa…
* Zoezi la kutengeneza bajeti
* Simulizi & majadiliano – ilifanikiwa!
* Simulizi & majadiliano – hayakufanikiwa…
* Majadiliano kuhusu njia za kuweka akiba
* Zoezi la kuweka akiba
*Nyenzo: Jinsi ya kutengeneza bajeti & kuweka akiba
FIKIRI – CHAGUA – TENGENEZA – PANGA
* Mazoezi ya nyumbani yanayopendekezwa

SourceText:
It can be hard to make ends meet every month. Many families have this problem! 

Including @global.w_money_grandma - let's have a look:
text:
Kupata mahitaji ya kila siku linaweza kuwa jambo gumu. Familia nyingi zina tatizo hili!

Akiwemo @global.w_money_grandma – hebu tuangalie:
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_money_grandma: "I have been taking care of my grandchildren, @global.w_money_teen_girl and @global.w_money_teen_boy, since their parents died when they were young. We often struggle with money, as I only receive a small grant."
text: @global.w_money_grandma: "Nimekuwa nikiwatunza wajukuu wangu, @global.w_money_teen_girl na @global.w_money_teen_boy, tangu wazazi wao walipofariki wakiwa wadogo. Mara nyingi tunahangaika sana kupata pesa, kwani ninapata kiasi kidogo tu cha msaada."

SourceText: @global.w_money_grandma: "I am so stressed. I don’t have any money left. And now I’m fighting with my teens over things they want – again."
text: @global.w_money_grandma: "Nina msongo mkubwa wa mawazo. Sina pesa yoyote iliyobaki. Na sasa – kwa mara nyingine – ninapambana na vijana wangu kuhusu vitu wanavyotaka."
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText:
There are four steps for doing a family budget: 

Step 1: THINK
Step 2: CHOOSE
Step 3: BUILD
Step 4: PLAN

Let’s go through the steps together. You need:

- Papers (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and pens
- Stones or beans or anything with lots of bits to represent money
 
Take a minute to get these things before we start with the first step.
text:
Kuna hatua nne za kutengeneza bajeti ya familia:

Hatua ya Kwanza: FIKIRI
Hatua ya Pili: CHAGUA
Hatua ya Tatu: TENGENEZA
Hatua ya Nne: PANGA

Hebu tupitie hatua hizi pamoja. Unahitaji:

- Karatasi (au gazeti la zamani au kasha la karatasi nene) na kalamu
- Mawe au maharage au kitu chochote chenye chembechembe nyingi kitakachowakilisha pesa

Tumia dakika moja kutafuta vitu hivyo kabla hatujaanza hatua ya kwanza.

SourceText: A family budget can help @global.w_money_grandma - and YOU!
text: Bajeti ya familia inaweza kumsaidia @global.w_money_grandma – na WEWE!
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText:
There are four steps for doing a family budget: 

Step 1: THINK
Step 2: CHOOSE
Step 3: BUILD
Step 4: PLAN

Let’s go through the steps together.
text:
Kuna hatua nne za kutengeneza bajeti ya familia:

Hatua ya Kwanza: FIKIRI
Hatua ya Pili: CHAGUA
Hatua ya Tatu: TENGENEZA
Hatua ya Nne: PANGA

Hebu tupitie hatua hizi pamoja.

SourceText:
You need: 
* Papers (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and pens 
* Stones or beans or anything with lots of bits to represent money 

Take a minute to get these things before we start with the first step.
text:
Unahitaji:
- Karatasi (au gazeti la zamani au kasha la karatasi nene) na kalamu
- Mawe au maharage au kitu chochote chenye chembechembe nyingi kitakachowakilisha pesa

Tumia dakika moja kutafuta vitu hivyo kabla hatujaanza hatua ya kwanza.

SourceText: Think about what we spend money on each month.
text: Fikiria mambo tunayotumia pesa kila mwezi.

SourceText:
* Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen. 
* Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month. 
* Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month. (There is no need to share the numbers if you don’t want to.)
* Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text:
* Chukua kipande cha karatasi (au gazeti la zamani au kasha la karatasi nene) na kalamu.
* Chora picha za vitu vyote vinavyokufanya wewe na familia yako mtumie pesa kila mwezi.
* Andika pembeni mwa kila picha kiasi ambacho kitu hicho kinagharimu kila mwezi. (Hakuna haja ya kuwashirikisha wengine viwango hivyo kama hautaki kufanya hivyo.)
* Jumlisha kiasi cha pesa unazotakiwa kutumia kila mwezi.

SourceText:
Wonderful! You finished step 1! 

Let’s move on!
text:
Inastaajabisha! Umemaliza hatua ya kwanza!

Tuendelee!

SourceText:
* food 
* water & electricity 
* clothing 
* accounts 
* TV subscription 
* toiletries 
* salon 
* airtime 
* school fees 
* transport 
* insurance/policies 
* medication 
* entertainment/sports 
* rent 
* loans 
* church

* chakula

SourceText:
Talk together about your needs and wants

WANT: Something you can live without
NEED: Something you cannot live without
text:
Zungumzeni pamoja kuhusu mahitaji yenu na matakwa yenu

MATAKWA: Vitu ambavyo mnaweza kuishi bila kuwa navyo
MAHITAJI: Vitu ambavyo hamuwezi kuishi bila kuwa navyo

SourceText:
People often don’t see things in the same way. When we talk about our needs and wants, we understand each other better and can make good choices together on how to spend our money.

Look at your lists of things you spend money on and discuss:
* Which are NEEDS that you can’t live without? Why?
* Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why? 
* Which things could you try to spend less money on as a family?
text:
Mara nyingi watu huona mambo kwa namna inayotofautiana. Tunapozungumzia mahitaji na matakwa yetu, tunaelewana vizuri zaidi na tunaweza kufanya uchaguzi mzuri zaidi pamoja kuhusu jinsi ya kutumia pesa zetu.

Angalieni orodha yenu ya vitu mnavyotumia pesa na mchague:
* Je, vitu gani ni MAHITAJI ambayo hamuwezi kuishi bila kuwa nayo? Kwa nini?
* Je, vitu gani ni MATAKWA kwani vinapendeza kuwa navyo lakini si vya lazima? Kwa nini?
* Je, kama familia, ni vitu gani vinaweza kuwafanya mjaribu kutumia pesa kidogo?

SourceText:
Think about your needs and wants

WANT: Something you can live without
NEED: Something you cannot live without
text:
Fikirieni kuhusu mahitaji na matakwa yenu

MATAKWA: Vitu ambavyo mnaweza kuishi bila kuwa navyo
MAHITAJI: Vitu ambavyo hamuwezi kuishi bila kuwa navyo

SourceText:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:
* Which are NEEDS that you can’t live without? Why?
* Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why? 
* Which things could you try to spend less money on?
text:
Angalieni orodha yenu ya vitu mnavyotumia, pesa na mchague:
* Je, vitu gani ni MAHITAJI ambayo hamuwezi kuishi bila kuwa nayo? Kwa nini?
* Je, vitu gani ni MATAKWA kwani vinapendeza kuwa navyo lakini si vya lazima? Kwa nini?
* Je, kama familia, ni vitu gani vinaweza kuwafanya mjaribu kutumia pesa kidogo?

SourceText: Make a budget!
text: Tengeneza bajeti!

SourceText: Make a budget as one big family!
text: Tengeneza bajeti kama familia moja kubwa!

SourceText:
* One person will volunteer to share his/her list (If no one volunteers you can make a new list together) 
* Take roles - some will be adults, some will be teens. 
* Decide what your income is for the month.
* Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. 
(For example: If your income is @global.currency@local.monthly_income, and you have @local.number_of_beans beans, each bean is @global.currency@local.bean_value.)  
* Decide together what you will spend on what, and put the stones/objects on that image. 

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That’s totally fine!
text:
* Mtu mmoja ajitolee kuwashirikisha wengine orodha yake (Kama hakuna mtu anayejitolea, mnaweza kutengeneza orodha mpya pamoja)
* Gawaneni majukumu – wengine watakuwa watu wazima, wengine watakuwa vijana.
* Amueni kipato chenu kwa mwezi ni kiasi gani.
* Chukueni mawe au maharage kadhaa au kitu chochote chenye chembechembe nyingi – hicho ndicho kipato chenu kwa mwezi.
(Kwa mfano: Kama kipato chenu ni @global.currency@local.monthly_income, na mna maharage @local.number_of_beans, kila harage ni @global.currency@local.bean_value.)
* Amueni pamoja mtatumia kiasi gani kwenye kitu gani, na muweke mawe/vitu kwenye picha hiyo.

Hamna hakika kuhusu maamuzi yenu? Mnasumbuka kuamua "mahitaji" ni yapi na "matakwa" ni yapi? Hakuna shida kabisa!

SourceText: Make a budget as a family!
text: Tengeneza bajeti kama familia!

SourceText:
* Write down what your income is for the month.
* Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. 
(For example: If your income is @global.currency@local.monthly_income, and you have @local.number_of_beans beans, each bean is @global.currency@local.bean_value.)
* Decide what you will spend on what, and put the stones/objects on that image. 

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That’s totally fine!
text:
* Andikeni kipato chenu kwa mwezi.
* Chukueni mawe au maharage kadhaa au kitu chochote cha chembechembe – hicho ndicho kipato chenu kwa mwezi.
(Kwa mfano: Kama kipato chenu ni @global.currency@local.monthly_income, na mna maharage @local.number_of_beans, kila harage ni @global.currency@local.bean_value.)
* Amueni mtatumia kiasi gani kwenye kitu gani, na muweke mawe/vitu kwenye picha hiyo.

Hamna hakika kuhusu maamuzi yenu? Mnasumbuka kuamua "mahitaji" ni yapi na "matakwa" ni yapi? Hakuna shida kabisa!

SourceText:
Great work, you have completed the first 3 steps! 

Let's see how @global.w_money_grandma made a plan with her money, just like you are doing:
text:
Kazi nzuri sana, mmekamilisha hatua 3 za kwanza!

Hebu tuone jinsi @global.w_money_grandma alivyoweka mpango wa pesa zake, kama tu mnavyofanya:
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText:
"I want the best future for my grandchildren, but I don’t know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive. 

I should save, but that feels impossible!"
text:
"Ninataka wajukuu wangu wawe na maisha bora siku zijazo, lakini sijui mahali pa kupata pesa. Matapeli wa mikopo ni hatari na kuwalipa ni ghali sana.

Ninapaswa kuweka akiba, lakini ninahisi hilo haliwezekani!"

SourceText: "My goal is to make sure my grandson can go to high school and my granddaughter can reach her dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?"
text: "Lengo langu ni kuhakikisha mjukuu wangu wa kiume ataweza kupata elimu ya juu ya sekondari na mjukuu wangu wa kike anaweza kutimiza ndoto yake ya kusoma chuo kikuu. Ninawezaje kuweka akiba ya pesa nyingi kutokana na pesa kidogo nilizo nazo?"

SourceText: "I know - let’s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget – a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time – I will even join a savings and loans group."
text: "Ninajua – hebu tuanze na mpango! Kwanza, ngoja nitengeneze bajeti – nipange ninavyoweza kuweka akiba ya pesa zangu. Halafu nitaweka akiba ya pesa kidogo tu kwa wakati mmoja – nitajiunga hata na kikundi cha kuweka na kukopa."

SourceText: "I should also speak with my grandchildren to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but don’t need."
text: "Ninapaswa pia kuzungumza na wajukuu wangu wachague vitu vinavyotuwezesha kutumia pesa kidogo kila wiki. Watanisaidia kufikiria vitu tunavyovitaka lakini hatuvihitaji."

SourceText:
A few years later:

"Look, we reached our dreams! I didn’t borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for @global.w_money_teen_boy’s high school and save some money for @global.w_money_teen_girl’s university. I am so proud of this.”
text:
Miaka michache baadaye:

"Ona, tumetimiza ndoto zetu! Sikukopa pesa yoyote kwa marafiki au kwa matapeli wa mikopo. Kwa kuweka akiba kidogokidogo kila wiki, niliweza kulipia ada ya sekondari kwa @global.w_money_teen_boy na kuweka akiba kwa ajili ya chuo kikuu ya @global.w_money_teen_girl. Ninajivunia sana jambo hili.”

SourceText: What are your  family savings goals?
text: Je, malengo ya familia yako ya kuweka akiba ni yapi?

SourceText:
Such great goals! 

Such a great goal! When we make a good budget and saving plan together, we can achieve it and feel proud of ourselves!
text:
Hayo ni malengo mazuri sana!

Hilo ni lengo zuri sana! Tunapopanga pamoja bajeti nzuri na mpango mzuri wa kuweka akiba, tunaweza kufanikiwa na kuona fahari!

SourceText: We all have dreams for our family, just like @global.w_money_grandma. By setting aside a bit of money every month, you can realise them too!
text: Sisi sote tuna ndoto kwa ajili ya familia zetu, kama alivyo @global.w_money_grandma. Kwa kutenga pesa kidogokidogo kila mwezi, unaweza pia kuzitimiza malengo hayo!
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: What are your family savings goals?
text: Je, malengo ya familia yako ya kuweka akiba ni yapi?

SourceText:
Such a great goal! 

By making a good budget and saving plan, you can achieve it and feel proud of yourself!
text:
Hilo ni lengo zuri sana!

Kwa kutengeneza bajeti nzuri na mpango mzuri wa kuweka akiba, unaweza kufanikiwa na kuona fahari!

SourceText: Saving is important for one more reason: emergencies! @global.w_money_grandma also learned this along the way:
text: Kuweka akiba ni muhimu kwa sababu moja zaidi: dharura! @global.w_money_grandma naye alijifunza hivyo:
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: “One night there was a horrible storm that broke my roof. Everything was flooded. I suddenly had to find money to fix the roof. I just felt defeated.”
text: “Usiku mmoja kulikuwa na dhoruba ya kutisha iliyoezua paa la nyumba yangu. Kila kitu kiliharibiwa na mafuriko. Ghafla ilibidi nitafute pesa za kukarabati paa. Nilihisi kushindwa kabisa.”

SourceText: Let's talk about this story.
text: Hebu tuzungumzie simulizi hii.

SourceText:
For @global.w_money_grandma, a storm happened. 

What other emergencies could come up for us?
text:
Kwa @global.w_money_grandma, dhoruba ilitokea.

Je, kuna dharura gani nyingine zinazoweza kutokea?
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: Let's think about this story.
text: Hebu tufikirie kuhusu simulizi hii.

SourceText: For @global.w_money_grandma, a storm happened.
text: Kwa @global.w_money_grandma, dhoruba ilitokea.
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: What other emergencies could come up for your family?
text: Je, kuna dharura gani nyingine zinazoweza kutokea kwenye familia yako?

SourceText: Emergencies can happen in any family. Saving some money for these emergencies BEFORE they happen prevents a lot of sudden worry and stress!
text: Dharura zinaweza kutokea kwenye familia yoyote. Kuweka akiba ya pesa kwa ajili ya dharura hizi KABLA hazijatokea huzuia wasiwasi mwingi na msongo wa mawazo wa ghafla!

SourceText: Let's talk about different ways we can save.
text: Hebu tuzungumzie njia mbalimbali za kujiwekea akiba.

SourceText:
Discuss together: 
* In which different ways can we save?  
* What are the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option? 

Understanding each option well will help you to decide what is the best saving option for your family.  

Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!
text:
Jadilini pamoja:
* Je, kuna njia zipi tunazoweza kuzitumia kujiwekea akiba?
* Je, kuna faida na hasara zipi kwa kila njia ya kujiwekea akiba?

Kuelewa vizuri kila njia kutawasaidia kuamua njia iliyo bora zaidi ya kuweka akiba kwa familia yenu.

Njia yoyote ya kujiwekea akiba mtakayoichagua itaisaidia sana familia yenu kusonga mbele!

SourceText: Let's think about different ways we can save.
text: Hebu tuzungumzie njia mbalimbali za kujiwekea akiba.

SourceText:
There are different ways we can save: at home, buying things we can sell later, at a bank, or in a savings group.

Think of the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option.
text:
Kuna njia mbalimbali tunazoweza kuzitumia kujiwekea akiba: nyumbani, kununua vitu tunavyoweza kuviuza baadaye, benki, au kwenye kikundi cha kuweka akiba.

Fikiria faida na hasara za kila njia ya kujiwekea akiba.

SourceText: What is the best savings option for your family?
text: Je, njia ipi ya kujiwekea akiba ni bora zaidi kwa familia yenu?

SourceText: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!
text: Njia yoyote ya kujiwekea akiba mtakayoichagua itaisaidia sana familia yenu kusonga mbele!

SourceText: Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!
text: Pangeni jinsi mnavyoweza kuweka akiba ya pesa, ili muweze kukabiliana na dharura na kutimiza malengo ya familia yenu!

SourceText:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergency - it can make a big difference over time. 
* Add a circle called “emergencies”.
* Add a circle called “family goals”.
* Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for each of these.
text:
Kama mnaweza kuweka akiba hata kiasi kidogo kwa ajili ya siku zijazo au dharura – kinaweza kusaidia sana.
* Wekeni mduara uitwao "dharura".
* Wekeni mduara uitwao "malengo ya familia".
* Sasa jaribuni kugawanya pesa zenu ili muweze kuweka akiba kidogo kila mwezi kwa mambo yote haya.

SourceText: CONGRATULATIONS!!! You’ve made your family budget – and using it will make a huge difference for you. I think every person in your group deserves a praise, don’t you?
text: HONGERA!!! Mmetengeneza bajeti ya familia yenu – na kuitumia kutakuletea mabadiliko makubwa. Ninadhani kila mtu kwenye kikundi chenu anastahili kusifiwa, au sivyo?

SourceText: CONGRATULATIONS!!! You’ve made your family budget – and using it will make a huge difference for you. I think every person in your family deserves a praise, don’t you?
text: HONGERA!!! Mmetengeneza bajeti ya familia yako – na kuitumia kutakuletea mabadiliko makubwa. Ninadhani kila mtu katika familia yako anastahili kusifiwa, au sivyo?

SourceText: CONGRATULATIONS!!! You’ve made your budget – remember to do this exercise again with your other family members - if you agree on a plan together it will make a huge difference!
text: HONGERA!!! Umetengeneza bajeti yako – kumbuka kufanya zoezi hili tena na wanafamilia wengine – kama mtakubaliana kuhusu mpango fulani pamoja, mpango huo utaleta mabadiliko makubwa!

SourceText: Step 1: THINK
text: Hatua ya Kwanza: FIKIRI

SourceText: What do we spend on now?
text: Kwa sasa tunatumia pesa kwenye mambo gani?

SourceText: THINK Activity
text: Shughuli ya KUFIKIRI

SourceText: Step 2: CHOOSE
text: Hatua ya Pili: CHAGUA

SourceText: Talk together about needs and wants
text: Zungumzeni pamoja kuhusu mahitaji na matakwa

SourceText: CHOOSE Activity
text: Shughuli ya KUCHAGUA

SourceText: Step 3: BUILD
text: Hatua ya Tatu: TENGENEZA

SourceText: Make your own budget
text: Tengeneza bajeti yako mwenyewe

SourceText: BUILD Activity
text: Shughuli ya KUTENGENEZA

SourceText: Step 4: PLAN
text: Hatua ya Nne: PANGA

SourceText: Emergencies and family goals
text: Dharura na malengo ya familia

SourceText: PLAN Activity
text: Shughuli ya KUPANGA

SourceText:
Make a budget again - this time WITH your teen and family! 

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.

Making a budget together helps teens understand that we all need to make hard decisions sometimes - but that it helps us have enough money at the end of the month and realise our goals!

Budgets have helped  millions of families.
text:
Tengeneza tena bajeti – mara hii pamoja NA kijana wako na familia yako!

Hili ni jambo muhimu na la kufurahisha la kufanya na familia yako – mtatumia kama dakika 30.

Kutengeneza bajeti pamoja husaidia vijana kuelewa kwamba sisi sote tunahitaji kufanya maamuzi magumu wakati mwingine – vilevile bajeti inatusaidia kuwa na pesa za kutosha mwishoni mwa mwezi na kutimiza malengo yetu!

Bajeti zimesaidia mamilioni ya familia.

SourceText:
Make a budget with your teen and family. 

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.

Making a budget together helps teens understand that we all need to make hard decisions sometimes - but that it helps us have enough money at the end of the month and realise our goals!

Budgets have helped  millions of families.
text:
Tengeneza bajeti na kijana wako na familia yako.

Hili ni jambo muhimu na la kufurahisha la kufanya na familia yako – linatumia kama dakika 30.

Kutengeneza bajeti pamoja husaidia vijana kuelewa kwamba sisi sote tunahitaji kufanya maamuzi magumu wakati mwingine – vilevile bajeti inatusaidia kuwa na pesa za kutosha mwishoni mwa mwezi na kutimiza malengo yetu!

Bajeti zimesaidia mamilioni ya familia.

SourceText:
Review your budget with your teen and family. This will remind everyone that we all need to make hard decisions sometimes - but that it helps us have enough money at the end of the month and realise our goals!

Budgets have helped millions of families.
text:
Pitia tena bajeti yako na kijana wako na familia yako. Kufanya hivyo kutamkumbusha kila mtu kwamba sisi sote tunahitaji kufanya maamuzi magumu wakati mwingine – vilevile kwamba bajeti inatusaidia kuwa na pesa za kutosha mwishoni mwa mwezi na kutimiza malengo yetu!

Bajeti zimesaidia mamilioni ya familia.

SourceText: Steps to make a budget
text: Hatua za kutengeneza bajeti

SourceText: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!
text: Inafurahisha sana kusikia kuwa unaendelea vizuri. Wewe ni mzazi mzuri sana!

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!
text: Pole kwa sababu leo siyo siku nzuri sana kwako. Hongera kwa kujaribu kuelewa kila kitu. Hakuna ajuaye kila kitu, lakini kwa kweli unajitahidi kwa kadri uwezavyo!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kwamba leo siyo siku nzuri kwako. Hongera kwa kuamka kila asubuhi na kujaribu tena, hata unapokuwa umechoka. Huo ni ujasiri wa kweli na kujitoa kwa dhati!

SourceText: Step 1: Share what went well and what was hard
text: Hatua ya Kwanza: Shirikisha wengine mambo yaliyoenda vizuri na yaliyokuwa magumu

SourceText: "I learned so much more about my teen’s life when we spent one-on-one time! But after the first day, my teen only wanted to play on his phone."
text: "Nilijifunza mambo mengi zaidi kuhusu maisha ya kijana wangu tulipotumia muda wa pamoja wawili tu! Lakini baada ya siku ya kwanza, kijana wangu alitaka kucheza tu kwenye simu yake."

SourceText: Step 2: Bring ideas!
text: Hatua ya Pili: Changia mawazo!

SourceText:
"Well done for trying! Maybe you could suggest some other fun things you could do together with your teen."

"Yes, or you could do something together on his phone? Or he could show you how his phone works?"
text:
"Hongera kwa kujaribu! Pengine unaweza kupendekeza mambo mengine ya kufurahisha unayoweza kufanya pamoja na kijana wako."

"Ndiyo, au mnaweza kufanya pamoja kitu fulani kwenye simu yake? Au anaweza kukuonyesha jinsi simu yake inavyofanya kazi?"

SourceText: Step 3: Pick and try one!
text: Hatua ya Tatu: Chagua moja na ujaribu!

SourceText: “Thank you for those great ideas! Yes, let me ask my teen to show how his phone works tomorrow after school. Can one of you pretend to be my teen now, so I can practice asking?”
text: “Asante kwa mawazo hayo mazuri sana! Ndiyo, nitamwomba kijana wangu anioneshe jinsi simu yake inavyofanya kazi kesho akitoka shule. Je, mmoja wenu anaweza kuigiza kama kijana wangu, ili nifanye mazoezi ya kuuliza?"

SourceText:
Think about how your home activities went this week. 

Take turns to discuss:

* What went well and what was a problem?
* What solutions can you think of together?
* Pick one solution and try it later with your teen! 

(Or you can even practice it now  so it will be easier later!)
text:
Kumbuka jinsi shughuli zenu za nyumbani zilivyoenda wiki hii.

Jadilini kwa zamu:
* Je, nini kilienda vizuri na nini hakikwenda vizuri?
* Je, kuna njia zipi za utatuzi mnazoweza kuzifikiria pamoja?
* Chagueni njia moja ya utatuzi na mjaribu kuitumia baadaye kwa vijana wenu!

(Au mnaweza hata kuifanyia mazoezi sasa ili iwe rahisi zaidi baadaye!)

SourceText:
Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!
text:
Kusifia ni ujuzi wenye nguvu katika malezi.

Kama tutawasifia vijana wetu wanapofanya jambo vizuri, tutawaona wakifanya mambo mazuri zaidi na zaidi!

SourceText:
Greetings everyone. 

Our topic today is about praise. 

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see. 

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good too!
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada yetu ya leo inahusu kusifia.

Ni vizuri kuwasifia watoto wetu wanapofanya vizuri kwa sababu tunapofanya hivyo, watazidi kuifanya tabia nzuri tunayotaka kuiona.

Na tusisahau pia kujisifia sisi wenyewe tunapofanya mazuri!

SourceText:
* Effects of praise
* Story & discussion – that worked!
* Tools: How to praise
SEE IT - SAY IT - REPEAT IT
* Try it out!
* Home practice suggestions
text:
* Matokeo ya usifiaji
* Simulizi & majadiliano – ambayo yalifanikiwa!
* Nyenzo: Jinsi ya kusifia
ONA – SEMA – RUDIA
* Jaribuni!
* Mazoezi ya nyumbani yanayopendekezwa

SourceText:
* Effects of praise
* Story & reflection – that worked!
* Tools: How to praise
SEE IT - SAY IT - REPEAT IT
* Home practice suggestions
text:
* Matokeo ya usifiaji
* Simulizi & tafakari – ambayo ilifanikiwa!
* Nyenzo: Jinsi ya kusifia
ONA – SEMA – RUDIA
* Mazoezi ya nyumbani yanayopendekezwa

SourceText:
Share with each other:

* When last did someone thank you or say you did something great? 
* How did it make you feel? 
* How does it feel if you are not thanked or praised for what you do? 

We usually don’t get thanked or praised enough as parents. Maybe you can give your teens the right example and praise them first when they do something well!
text:
Shirikishaneni nyote:

* Ni lini mara ya mwisho mtu alikushukuru au kusema umefanya jambo zuri sana? 
* Ulijisikiaje? 
* Je, unajisikiaje usiposhukuriwa au kusifiwa kwa kile unachokifanya? 

Mara nyingi kama wazazi hatushukuriwi au kusifiwa vya kutosha. Pengine unaweza kuwapa vijana wako mfano sahihi kwa kuwasifia kwanza wanapofanya kitu vizuri!

SourceText: Think about the last time someone thanked you, or said you did something great.
text: Kumbuka mara ya mwisho mtu alipokushukuru, au kusema umefanya jambo zuri sana.

SourceText: How did it make you feel?
text: Ulijisikiaje?

SourceText: Parents usually don’t get thanked or praised enough.
text: Mara nyingi wazazi hawashukuriwi au kusifiwa vya kutosha.

SourceText: How does it make you feel when nobody says "thank you"?
text: Je, unajisikiaje usipoambiwa "asante" na mtu yeyote?

SourceText: Tired
text: Uchovu

SourceText: Your teen can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.
text: Kijana wako anaweza pia kujisikia hivyo. Hicho ndicho kinachofanya nyenzo ya malezi ya wiki hii iwe rahisi lakini muhimu: Msifie anapofanya vizuri.

SourceText:
Praise really is powerful. 

Let’s look at the example of @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name and her daughters:
text:
Kusifia kuna nguvu sana.

Hebu tuangalie mfano wa @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name na mabinti zake:
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: When @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name is busy, her two daughters often fight. But today, her older daughter actually helped her sister with her schoolwork!
text: Pindi @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name anapotingwa na shughuli, mara nyingi mabinti zake wawili hupigana. Lakini leo, binti yake mkubwa alimsaidia mdogo wake kufanya kazi yake ya shule!
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name: "Thank you for doing your schoolwork, @global.w_praise_girl, and thank you for helping your sister,  @global.w_praise_teen_girl. I'm so proud of you!"
text: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name: "Hongera kwa kufanya kazi yako ya shule, @global.w_praise_girl, na hongera kwa kumsaidia mdogo wako, @global.w_praise_teen_girl. Ninajivunia sana wewe!"

SourceText: Let's discuss this story.
text: Hebu tujadili simulizi hii.

SourceText:
Discuss together:

* How did praise make @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name's teens feel?
* Why did she praise them?
text:
Jadili pamoja:

* Je, kusifia kuliwafanya vijana wa @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name wajisikieje?
* Kwa nini aliwasifia?
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name praised her teens...
text: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name aliwasifia vijana wake...
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
* To get them to do it more often
* To help her finish her work 
* To make them feel good 
* To make herself feel good
text:
* Ili kuwafanya wazidi kufanya hivyo mara nyingi
* Ili kumsaidia amalize kazi zake 
* Ili kuwafanya wajisikie vizuri 
* Ili yeye mwenyewe ajisikie vizuri

SourceText: How did praise make @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name's teens feel?
text: Je, kusifia kuliwafanya vijana wa @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name wajisikieje?
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Why did she praise them?
text: Kwa nini aliwasifia?

SourceText: To get them to do it more often
text: Ili kuwafanya wazidi kufanya hivyo mara nyingi

SourceText: To help her finish her work
text: Kumsaidia amalize kazi yake

SourceText: To make them feel good
text: Ili kuwafanya wajisikie vizuri

SourceText: To make herself feel good
text: Ili yeye mwenyewe ajisikie vizuri

SourceText:
All of those things are true! 

When her teens are happy, @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name feels happy. And she got her work done.
text:
Mambo yote hayo ni ya kweli!

Pindi vijana wake wanapofurahi, @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name hujisikia furaha. Na aliweza kufanya kazi zake.
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: The same can work for you!
text: Wewe pia unaweza kufanya hivyo!

SourceText: SEE IT
text: ONA

SourceText: Look for anything your teen does that is helpful or good, and praise them for it. They may not show it, but you’ll see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
text: Tafuta kitu chochote anachofanya kijana wako kwa ajili ya kusaidia au kilicho kizuri, na umsifie kwa kitu hicho. Anaweza asioneshe furaha yake, lakini utamwona akifanya tena kitu hicho kizuri. Pia itamthibitishia kuwa unatambua anachokifanya na unajali.

SourceText: SAY IT
text: SEMA

SourceText: Be enthusiastic – really mean it when you say it!
text: Onyesha shauku – unaposema jambo, liseme kwa moyo wa dhati!

SourceText: REPEAT IT
text: RUDIA

SourceText: Try to find something to thank them for every day. Even something really small.
text: Jaribu kutafuta kitu cha kukufanya umshukuru kila siku. Hata kitu kidogo sana.

SourceText: You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!
text: Unaweza pia kuwasifia watu wazima wengine kwenye kaya yako. Chunguza mwitikio utakavyokuwa!

SourceText: Let's practice giving praise.
text: Hebu tufanye mazoezi ya kusifia.

SourceText:
Share with each other: 

* What can you praise your teen for? 
* What has someone else done well during this workshop? Tell them!
* How did it make you feel to praise someone?
* How did it make you feel to be praised?
text:
Shirikishaneni nyote:

* Je, unaweza kumsifia kijana wako kwa kitu gani?
* Je, ni kitu gani ambacho mtu mwingine amefanya vizuri kwenye warsha hii? Mwambie!
* Je, ulijisikiaje kumsifia mtu?
* Je, ulijisikiaje kusifiwa?

SourceText: Sometimes it’s hard to think of what to praise your teen for! Here are some ideas from other parents:
text: Wakati mwingine ni vigumu kufikiria kitu gani cha kumsifia kijana wako! Haya ni mawazo kutoka kwa wazazi wengine:

SourceText:
* Being kind to someone 
* Cleaning their room 
* Joining a family meal 
* Greeting other family members 
* Looking after siblings 
* Coming home in time 
* Showing thoughtfulness 
* Saying 'please' or 'thank you' 
* Going to school  
* Doing chores or schoolwork  
* Getting through mealtime peacefully
text:
* Kumtendea mtu wema
* Kusafisha chumba chake
* Kula pamoja na familia
* Kuwasalimu wanafamilia wengine
* Kuwatunza ndugu zake
* Kuwahi kurudi nyumbani
* Kuwafikiria wengine
* Kusema 'tafadhali' au 'asante'
* Kwenda shule
* Kufanya kazi za nyumbani au kazi ya shule
* Kumaliza wakati wa kula kwa amani

SourceText: This week's home practice is to praise your teen once a day. It will only take 10 seconds!
text: Zoezi la nyumbani la wiki hii ni kumsifia kijana wako mara moja kwa siku. Utatumia sekunde 10 tu!

SourceText: Remember that YOU matter!
text: Kumbuka kwamba WEWE ni mtu muhimu!

SourceText: Well done for recognising a positive feeling. I am happy to hear you are feeling well today!
text: Hongera kwa kutambua hisia chanya. Nimefurahi kusikia kwamba unajisikia vizuri leo!

SourceText: Well done for recognising a difficult feeling. It’s okay not to be okay sometimes. Remember you are not alone.
text: Hongera kwa kutambua hisia mbaya. Si ajabu kutojisikia vizuri wakati mwingine. Kumbuka kwamba hauko peke yako.

SourceText: This is just incredible. Every one of these habits is making your family stronger. Be proud.
text: Hili ni jambo zuri sana. Kila mojawapo ya tabia hizi huifanya familia yako kuwa imara zaidi. Jivunie.

SourceText:
Rules help teens understand what is expected from them. 

Teens are more likely to follow rules if you create the rules WITH your teen and praise them for it!
text:
Sheria huwasaidia vijana kuelewa wanachotakiwa kukifanya.

Vijana wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kufuata sheria kama mtaweka sheria hizo PAMOJA na kumsifia anapozifuata!

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is rules. 

Rules promote peace within the household and promote understanding amongst family members. 

Rules promote responsibilities for each family member; therefore, it is important to have family rules. 

A household with family rules lives in peace.
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada ya leo inahusu sheria.

Sheria huleta amani ndani ya kaya na maelewano miongoni mwa wanafamilia.

Sheria huleta uwajibikaji kwa kila mwanafamilia; kwa hiyo, ni muhimu kuwa na sheria za familia.

Kaya yenye sheria za familia huishi kwa amani.

SourceText:

SourceText: Let's read what happened with @global.w_rules_teen_boy and his @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1:
text: Hebu tusome kilichotokea kwa @global.w_rules_teen_boy na @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1:

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: "You always come home late!"

@global.w_rules_teen_boy: "No I don’t, I don’t even know what late means! Stop nagging me."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: "Kila wakati unachelewa kurudi nyumbani!"

@global.w_rules_teen_boy: "Siyo kweli, hata sijui kuchelewa maana yake ni nini! Acha kunisumbua."

SourceText: Which specific rule could @global.w_rules_teen_boy and @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 create together?
text: Je, ni sheria ipi maalum ambayo @global.w_rules_teen_boy na @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 wanaweza kutengeza kwa pamoja?

SourceText: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “That’s right, and it’s also not safe in this area to be outside after sunset. What do you think would be a good time for you to be home?”
text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: "Hiyo ni kweli, na vilevile sio salama kwenye eneo hili kuwa huko nje baada ya jua kuzama. Unafikiri ni muda gani mzuri kwako kurudi nyumbani?”
note: The string @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “I could come home at 10pm?"  

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “That’s a bit late, what about 6pm? Or something in the middle?"
text:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Je, ninaweza kurudi nyumbani saa 4 usiku?"

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Hapo utakuwa umechelewa kidogo, vipi saa 12 jioni? Au katikati hapo?"

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “I could come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Friday and Saturday?” 

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Yes, great. From now on, our household rule is that you need to come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Friday and Saturday. But you always walk home with a friend. Okay?”
text:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Je, ninaweza kurudi nyumbani saa 12 jioni siku ninazoamka kwenda shule na saa 4 usiku siku za Ijumaa na Jumamosi?”

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Ndiyo, safi sana. Kuanzia sasa, sheria yetu hapa nyumbani ni kwamba unatakiwa kurudi nyumbani saa 12 jioni siku unazoamka kwenda shule na saa 4 usiku siku za Ijumaa na Jumamosi. Lakini kila wakati uje nyumbani na rafiki. Sawa?"

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Okay, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1” 

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Thank you very much, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, for helping to come up with a good rule together. I am proud to see how responsible you are getting.”
text:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Sawa, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1”

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Asante sana, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, kwa kusaidia kuweka sheria nzuri pamoja. Ninaona fahari kuona jinsi unavyowajibika.”

SourceText:
The next day...

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Thank you, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, for coming home on time. After you finish your schoolwork we can have your favourite meal for dinner.”
text:
Siku iliyofuata...

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Asante, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, kwa kuwahi kuja nyumbani. Ukimaliza kazi zako za darasani, uje tuandae chakula ambacho huwa unapendelea kwa ajili ya usiku wa leo.”

SourceText: Making the rule together went well because...
text: Kutengeneza sheria pamoja kulienda vizuri kwa sababu...

SourceText:
* They discussed the reasons behind the rule 
* @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 listened to @global.w_rules_teen_boy’s suggestions 
* The rule was clear, specific and fair 
* @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 praised @global.w_rules_teen_boy for helping to make the rule
text:
* Walijadili sababu za kuwekwa kwa sheria hiyo
* @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 alisikiliza maoni ya @global.w_rules_teen_boy
* Sheria hiyo ilikuwa wazi, maalum na ya haki
* @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 alimsifia @global.w_rules_teen_boy kwa kusaidia kuweka sheria hiyo

SourceText: @global.w_rules_teen_boy knew his @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 appreciated him because...
text: @global.w_rules_teen_boy alijua kuwa @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 wake alimthamini kwa sababu...

SourceText:
* She praised him
* She rewarded him when he followed the rule
text:
* Alimsifia
* Alimzawadia alipofuata sheria

SourceText: What went well here in making a rule together?
text: Kwa kuweka sheria pamoja, jambo gani lilienda vizuri hapa?

SourceText: They discussed the reasons behind the rule
text: Walijadili sababu za kuwekwa kwa sheria hiyo

SourceText: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 listened to @global.w_rules_teen_boy’s suggestions
text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 alisikiliza maoni ya @global.w_rules_teen_boy

SourceText: The rule was clear, specific and fair
text: Sheria hiyo ilikuwa wazi, maalum na ya haki

SourceText: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 praised @global.w_rules_teen_boy for helping to make the rule
text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 alimsifia @global.w_rules_teen_boy kwa kusaidia kuweka sheria

SourceText: That's right, making clear rules together in a calm and positive way works so well!
text: Hiyo ni kweli, kuweka sheria zilizo wazi kwa kushirikiana na kwa njia ya utulivu na chanya huleta mafanikio makubwa!

SourceText: How do you think @global.w_rules_teen_boy knew his @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 appreciated him?
text: Je, unafikiri @global.w_rules_teen_boy alijuaje kuwa @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 wake anamthamini?

SourceText: She praised him
text: Alimsifia

SourceText: She rewarded him when he followed the rule
text: Alimzawadia alipofuata sheria

SourceText: Exactly - a positive response makes all the difference!
text: Sawasawa – mwitikio chanya huleta mabadiliko makubwa!

SourceText: Household rules help keep our teenagers safe, and understand what is expected from them. When you involve a teenager in making rules they are more likely to follow them.
text: Sheria za kaya husaidia kuwaweka vijana wetu salama, na kuelewa kinachotarajiwa kutoka kwao. Unapomhusisha kijana katika kutengeneza sheria, anakuwa na uwezekano mkubwa wa kuzifuata.

SourceText: TEAM RULES
text: SHERIA ZA KIKUNDI

SourceText: Plan rules WITH your teenager. Start with one new rule first - you can add another one later. Discuss the reasons for the rule and listen to their views.
text: Panga sheria PAMOJA NA kijana wako. Anza kwanza na sheria mpya moja – unaweza kuongeza nyingine baadaye. Jadilini sababu za kuweka sheria na usikilize maoni yake.

SourceText: REAL RULES
text: SHERIA ZINAZOTEKELEZEKA

SourceText: Make them realistic for what your teenager can do, and be clear and specific so there’s no misunderstanding. Not ‘on time’ but ‘by 7pm’.
text: Zifanye ziweze kutekelezeka kwa kijana wako, na uwe wazi na bayana ili kusitokee kutokuelewana. Usiseme 'kwa wakati', sema 'ifikapo saa 1 jioni'.

SourceText: PRAISE RULES!
text: SHERIA ZA USIFIAJI!

SourceText: Praise your teen for planning a rule with you, and praise them for keeping it!
text: Msifie kijana wako kwa kuweka sheria pamoja na wewe, na msifie kwa kuifuata!

SourceText: Online Safety
text: Usalama Mtandaoni

SourceText: Rules are important to keep your teens safe - also online. There’s more about this in the Weekly Workshop on safety planning, but let’s already have a first look now!
text: Sheria ni muhimu ili kuwaweka salama vijana wako – hadi mtandaoni. Kuna mengi zaidi kuhusu jambo hili kwenye Warsha ya Wiki inayohusu kupanga usalama, lakini sasa ngoja tungalie kitu cha kwanza!

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "@global.w_rules_teen_girl, have you done your homework?"

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "Just a minute @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2, I’m finishing this @global.teen_social_medium video"
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "@global.w_rules_teen_girl, umefanya kazi ya nyumbani?"

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "Subiri kidogo @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2, ninamalizia hii video ya @global.teen_social_medium"

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like it"

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "All my friends are on it, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "Unajua kucheza kwelikweli! Niambie kwa nini unaipenda."

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "Marafiki zangu wote wamejiunga, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2. Nina waipendao zaidi ya 600 na wafuasi 120."

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "I’m proud of how well you dance, @global.w_rules_teen_girl. But we need to make sure you are safe. 

I know your friends look at @global.teen_social_medium, but with an open account, there are other people who look at videos of teenagers for their own sexual needs. Sometimes they contact teenagers. They pretend to be nice but end up threatening and abusing teens."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "Ninajuvia sana jinsi unavyocheza vizuri, @global.w_rules_teen_girl. Lakini tunahitaji kuhakikisha kuwa uko salama.

Ninajua marafiki zako wanaangalia @global.teen_social_medium, lakini unapotumia akaunti huria, elewa kwamba kuna watu wengine wanaotazama video za vijana ili kukidhi mahitaji yao ya kingono. Wakati mwingine wanawasiliana na vijana. Wanajifanya kuwa watu wema lakini wanaishia kuwatishia na kuwadhalilisha vijana."

SourceText: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "I’m proud of you @global.w_rules_teen_girl"
text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "Ninajivunia sana wewe @global.w_rules_teen_girl."

SourceText:
* What is one important rule you’d each like to make with your teenager? 
* What do you think your teen will think about that rule? 

Remember, make rules specific and realistic!
text:
* Je, ni sheria gani moja muhimu ambayo kila mmoja wenu angependa kuiweka na kijana wake?
* Je, unadhani kijana wako atafikiriaje kuhusu sheria hiyo?

Kumbuka, sheria ziwe bayana na zinazotekelezeka!

SourceText: Here are some of the rules other families created:
text: Hapa kuna baadhi ya sheria zilizowekwa na familia nyingine:

SourceText:
* Teen can play outside after finishing homework
* All family members are eating dinner together
* Teen 1 does dishes on Sunday and Monday, Teen 2 on Tuesday and Wednesday
* We speak to each other politely and nicely
* When listening to music you need to use earphones
text:
* Kijana anaweza kucheza nje baada ya kumaliza kazi ya nyumbani
* Wanafamilia wote watakula mlo wa usiku pamoja
* Kijana "A" ataosha vyombo siku ya Jumapili na Jumatatu, Kijana "B" siku ya Jumanne na Jumatano
* Tutazungumza baina yetu kwa adabu na kwa wema
* Unaposikiliza muziki, unatakiwa kutumia vifaa vya kusikilizia

SourceText: Let's practice making rules.
text: Hebu tufanye mazoezi ya kutengeneza sheria.

SourceText:
Write down one important rule you’d like to make with your teenager – you'll be doing this as your home practice this week. 

What will they think about it?
text:
Andika sheria moja muhimu ambayo ungependa kuiweka na kijana wako – hili ndilo litakuwa zoezi lako la nyumbani wiki hii.

Je, atafikiria nini kuhusu sheria hii?

SourceText:
This week, set one rule together with your teen.

Remember to praise your teen afterwards!
text:
Wiki hii, tengeneza sheria moja pamoja na kijana wako.

Kumbuka kumsifia kijana wako baadaye!

SourceText: Being a great parent also means taking time to care for yourself every day.
text: Kuwa mzazi mzuri kunamaanisha pia kutumia muda ili kujitunza wewe mwenyewe kila siku.

SourceText: Great. And amazing that you are using this app – it shows your commitment as a parent. Make sure you give yourself credit and praise for what you are doing.
text: Safi sana. Na inapendeza sana kuona unatumia programu hii – inaonyesha jinsi unavyojitoa kwa dhati kama mzazi. Hakikisha unajitambua na kujisifia kwa kile unachokifanya.

SourceText: Being a parent is hard. But it is amazing that you are using this app – it shows your commitment as a parent. Make sure you give yourself credit and praise for what you are doing.
text: Kuwa mzazi ni jambo gumu. Lakini inapendeza sana kuona unatumia programu hii – inaonyesha jinsi unavyojitolea kwa dhati kama mzazi. Hakikisha unajitambua na kujisifia kwa kile unachokifanya.

SourceText: Doing any of these makes you a great parent.
text: Kufanya jambo lolote kati ya haya hukufanya uwe mzazi mzuri sana.

SourceText:
Teens can spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe. 

Talking together about safe and unsafe places, and how to prevent problems, really helps!
text:
Vijana wanaweza kutumia muda mwingi nje ya nyumba au mtandaoni, ambako ni vigumu kwetu kuwaweka salama.

Kuzungumza pamoja kuhusu maeneo salama na yasiyo salama, na jinsi ya kuzuia matatizo, husaidia sana!

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today our topic is teen safety. 

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities. 

It is also our responsibility to ensure that they understand the dangers that they might be exposed to when they are online. That way our teenagers will be responsible and be able to make right decisions to keep themselves safe too.
text:
Habari zenu?

Leo mada yetu inahusu usalama wa vijana.

Kama wazazi, ni jukumu letu kuwaweka salama vijana wetu wakati wote. Tunahitaji kuhakikisha kuwa vijana wetu wako salama katika jamii tunazoishi. Ni jukumu letu kuwafahamisha maeneo salama na yasiyo salama katika jamii hizo.

Pia ni jukumu letu kuhakikisha kwamba wanaelewa hatari zinazoweza kuwakabili wanapokuwa mtandaoni. Kwa njia hiyo, vijana wetu watawajibika na wataweza kufanya maamuzi sahihi ya kujiweka salama.

SourceText:
Communication is the most important thing!

Let's see what happened with @global.w_safe_female_caregiver and @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1:
text:
Mawasiliano ni jambo muhimu zaidi!

Hebu tuangalie kile kilichotokea kwa @global.w_safe_female_caregiver na @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1:

SourceText:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Something happened when I was out with my friends @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2 and @global.w_safe_teen_girl_3!"

@global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Tell me, @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1"
text:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Kuna kitu kilitokea nilipoenda kutembea na marafiki zangu @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2 na @global.w_safe_teen_girl_3!"

@global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Niambie, @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1"

SourceText:
Man in car: “Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what’s your name?  

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “Her name is @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1”
text:
Mwanaume ndani ya gari: “Halo, mrembo. Nimekuwa nakuona kwa muda. Wewe ni mrembo sana, unaitwa nani?

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: "Anaitwa @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1"

SourceText:
Man in car: “@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you’ll be back in time, I promise…” 

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: “I’m not sure if that’s a good idea…”
text:
Mwanaume ndani ya gari: "@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1, ungependa kuongozana nami tukapate chipsi na kinywaji? Twende, ingia, utawahi kurudi, nakuahidi… ”

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Sidhani kama hilo ni wazo zuri…"

SourceText: @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I’m telling you, if you don’t do this I’m going to tell everyone you are stupid!”
text: @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “Una bahati, shoga yangu. Natamani mwanamume aniombe MIMI tutoke akaninunulie zawadi. Ninakuambia, usipofanya hivyo, nitaenda nimwambie kila mtu kuwa wewe ni mjinga!”
note: The string @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2 should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_3: “@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 don’t go! Be careful! Let’s go home. It is dangerous to go with people you don’t know. Besides, he’s too old for you and what he is doing is wrong."

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: “I just don’t know…”
text:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_3: “@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1, usiende! Kuwa mwangalifu! Twende nyumbani. Ni hatari kwenda na watu usiowajua. Tena, mtu mwenyewe ni mkubwa sana kwako na anachokifanya sio sawa."

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Hata sijui nifanye nini…"

SourceText: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Pfff, I am so proud of you that you did not get into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!"
text: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Ninafurahi sana kwamba hukuingia kwenye gari. Hiyo ilikuwa hali ya hatari, asante kwa kuniambia!"
note: The string @global.w_safe_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: Let's talk about what happened to @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1
text: Hebu tuzungumzie kile kilichotokea kwa @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1
note: The string @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText:
Discuss together: 

What was risky about that situation?
text:
Jadilini pamoja:

Kitu gani kilikuwa cha hatari kwenye tukio hilo?

SourceText: The situation was risky because...
text: Tukio hilo lilikuwa la hatari kwa sababu...

SourceText:
* The man in the car was pressuring  @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 with gifts 
* @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1's friend was encouraging her  
* Going with an older man puts @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 in a dangerous situation where she can get hurt or be forced to do things 
* Many girls in our communities get pregnant or catch HIV from older men 
* There were no other trusted adults to advise @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1
text:
* Mwanaume ndani ya gari alikuwa akimshinikiza @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 kwa zawadi
* Rafiki yake @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 alikuwa akimtia moyo
* Kwenda na mwanaume mwenye umri mkubwa kunamweka @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 kwenye hali ya hatari kwani anaweza kuumizwa au kulazimishwa kufanya mambo fulani
* Wasichana wengi katika jamii zetu wanapata mimba au kuambukizwa VVU na wanaume wenye umri mkubwa
* Hakukuwa na watu wazima wengine wanaoaminika wa kumshauri @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1
